column4: Hi, I want to install Ubuntu on a Dell machine, replacing windows XP, but I do NOT want it to touch the partition table at all.  I just want it to use the existing windows XP partition as is so I can restore it back to the defaults when I'm done.  is this possible ?  I'm okay with always having to boot from CD or something similar.
Er... what?  Do you have a windows CD?
it's got a custom dell MBR which I don't want to break.
so, you don't want to touch the MBR? Or the partition table?
